intro: Lactuca sativa var. patula, commonly known as butterhead lettuce, is a cultivated variety of lettuce characterized by its loose, crinkled leaves that form a bulbous head. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is native to Europe and western Asia. The plant typically grows to a height of 20–40 cm, with dark green, tender leaves that have a mild, slightly sweet flavor. It is widely grown for fresh consumption in salads and as a garnish due to its delicate texture and nutritional value.
